relation: Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
small local chapters of some national Greek letter organizations.
not much in the way of interesting clubs other than the student government.

newly arrived non urbanites looking for a basic set of classes. high school students who want to speed up their college requirement clock by taking the classes at wc3 in the summer before beginning regular college in the fall.
located downtown behind joe louis arena so there will be difficulty parking when the redwings are playing. mostly because the campus does not have adequate parking for it's student load.

less expensive then other land grant colleges in the geographic area. take college level pre-requisites here to save cash. attend the short summer session for full credit classes in 2/3 the usual time requirement.
finish classes and get away from the non social campuses.
take your lunch unless you are at the downtown campus where they have a subway on the main floor.
classes are easy and professors test infrequently.
attend this school to pay less for basic college prereq's. don't plan to take classes in a logical sequence for the program; expect to encounter overfilled classes and overpriced textbooks.
basic college prep classes; poor research facilities; no student internet accounts to correspond with instructors for online students.

textAfterTable: no dorms but it seems to be a charge for one. when i asked why i'm being charged 11,000 for housing they told me that, i wasn't supposed to see that and i'm not being charged. Tips for prospective students if someone asked me about the school i would inform them to make sure they check to see if the program that they're interested in is accredited, if not they would be waisting their time. In three sentences from my past experience i would rate wayne county community college as a 10, 10 being the worst. i enrolled in the paralegal program in 2005 and wasn't inform that,that program wasn't accredited by the american bar association. until i had 2 paralegal class left to take. by the school not being accredited mean that if i wanted to go to another school or university none of the class that i took would transfer to the other school. so i've wasted my time. it would have save me some time had i known that in the beginning. Login to rate or flag the reviews Ashley from Harper Woods, MI 02/22/2012 Reviewer is A current student here. 1 out
